bug.short_desc: [abrt] util-linux: strlen(): login killed by SIGSEGV
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: login from tty3 using fingerprint cant get shell after auth
Version-Release number of selected component: util-linux-2.28-2.fc24
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.0 backtrace_rating: 4 cmdline: /bin/login -- ' ' crash_function: strlen executable: /usr/bin/login global_pid: 3746 kernel: 4.5.5-300.fc24.x86_64 pkg_fingerprint: 73BD E983 81B4 6521 pkg_vendor: Fedora Project reproducible: Not sure how to reproduce the problem runlevel: N 5 type: CCpp uid: 0
Truncated backtrace: Thread no. 1 (7 frames) #0 strlen at ../sysdeps/x86_64/strlen.S:106 #1 __strdup at strdup.c:41 #2 pam_sm_authenticate at pam_ecryptfs.c:193 #3 _pam_dispatch_aux at pam_dispatch.c:110 #4 _pam_dispatch at pam_dispatch.c:426 #5 pam_authenticate at pam_auth.c:34 #6 loginpam_auth at login-utils/login.c:798
*** Bug 1339718 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Thanks for reporting this. Could you tell me what authentication method did you use? Regular password or fingerprint reader or something different?
Oh, it's in the description, that you used fingerprint reader. I've missed that. I will look at this.
